2W0201








[solution]		 _____ 2W0202








[solution]      [Next]
2W0203








[solution]		 _____ 2W0204








[solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0201
    • The simplest is 1. Bd5+ and 2.
    • Kxh2 - maybe the best is
    • 1. Rf1 to guard the 7th rank

    		_____
  • 2W0202
    • 1. Rxd8+ Kxd8 2. Rc8 mate or Qc8
    • mate.
    • But REALLY neat is 1. Rxe7+ Qxe7
    • 2. Rd8 mate!

  • 2W0203
    • 1. Ne4 and the only thing that
    • stops mate for now is
    • 1. ... Bd8 2. Nxf6+ winning the
    • queen

    		_____
  • 2W0204
    • 1. Be4 tempoarily traps the queen.
    • Now 1. ... Nf2+
    • 2. Bxf2 Qc7 and white has won a
    • piece.

    2W0205








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0206








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0207








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0208








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0205
    • 1. Rxe6! (Note the knight on e6 is
    • pinned.) Rd8 2.
    • Rxe7+! wins. Submitted by Sean
    • on ICC.

    		_____
  • 2W0206
    • 1. Rxd6! and now not Qxd6 because
    • of 2. Qg7 mate.
    • So 1. ... cxd6 2. Qxb6 wins the
    • exchange.

  • 2W0207
    • 1. Nb5 forks the queen and bishop.
    • If queen moves then 2. Nxd6 wins
    • the exchange in a complicated
    • position.

    		_____
  • 2W0208
    • 1. Rh8+ and now 1. ... Kg7 2. Qxh6
    • mate. If 1. ...
    • Kxh8 2. Qxh6+ forking the King
    • and Bishop on d6.

    2W0209








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0210








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0211








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0212








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0209
    • 1. f3 Qh5 2. g4 traps the queen.
    • So 1. f3 then Bg3+ is a way for
    • black to give up a piece to save
    • the queen.

    		_____
  • 2W0210
    • 1. Qxg6+ (note that the pawn of f7
    • is pinned.) 1.
    • ... Kh8 2. Qg7 mate. Sumitted
    • by Reddtrain on FICS.

  • 2W0211
    • 1. Qg5 and the threats of 2. Bf6
    • mate and 2. Bh6
    • mate can only be slowed down by
    • black giving up material.

    		_____
  • 2W0212
    • 1. Qf3 (or f4) + and now any king
    • move then 2. Qf7 mate. Black can
    • delay things one move by giving up
    • his queen.

    2W0213








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0214








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0215








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0216








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0213
    • 1. Bxf6 - the bishop is pinned -
    • black must give up
    • his queen to prevent Qxg7 mate ,
    • so 2. Qxf6 Rxf6 wins

    		_____
  • 2W0214
    • 1. Bxf7+ Kxf7 2. Ng5+ wins the
    • bishop on g4 (white
    • is up a pawn) and puts the black
    • king in a bad position.

  • 2W0215
    • The game Crafty - DGurevish (Speed
    • game on Internet
    • Chess Club) continued 1. Nxd5!
    • Bxg5 2. Nb6 with a fork!

    		_____
  • 2W0216
    • 1. Bf8+ Nh5 (forced) 2. Qh6 mate!
    • Thanks to mesh (Daniel McGuire) on
    • the Internet Chess Club for this
    • combination.

    2W0217








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0218








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0219








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0220








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0217
    • 1. Rg2+ mates real soon. If Kf8 or
    • Kh7 then 2. Qxg8
    • mate . black can delay mate by
    • giving up the bishop or queen

    		_____
  • 2W0218
    • 1. Nf5 threatens queen and the
    • knight. If 1. ... Nxf5 then 2.
    • Qe8 mate! So if 1. ... Qxe1+ 2.
    • Qxe1 Nxf5 white is better

  • 2W0219
    • 1. Ng6+ and now if 1. ... Ke8 2.
    • Rhe7 mate. But if
    • instead 1. ... Kg8 then 2. Rh8
    • mate or 2. Rg7 mate (eithor rook.)

    		_____
  • 2W0220
    • 1. Rxe4 wins the Bishop. If 1. ...
    • Qxe4 2. Nf6+
    • makes a discovered attack on the
    • Queen. If 1. ... Rc1+ 2. Re1
    • holds.
